conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric cutaway: walls extruded with thickness, floors as separate planes, multi-face wall surfaces visible, and ceiling/roof removed to reveal interior.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion with readable corners and volumes; good cutaway. Minor issues: some edges/joins are simplified and a few wall-top terminations feel slightly inconsistent.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout fidelity is strong: living/dining at left, kitchen+utility at lower middle, servant room near entry, and bedrooms/toilets clustered to the right/top. Adjacencies largely match. Some proportional differences and small partition/door placement deviations are visible (especially around corridors/toilets).

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present (living seating, dining table, beds), kitchen counters/appliances shown, and bathroom fixtures included. Scale/orientation generally logical; minor simplification in some rooms.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is clear and readable with decent lighting. Deducted for text labels printed on the 3D floor surfaces (UI contamination) and slight visual clutter from annotations; openings/windows are visible but not uniformly emphasized.

detected_errors.description: Text labels/room annotations appear inside the 3D render, reducing presentation cleanliness.
Some doors/windows/opening placements and proportions appear simplified or slightly shifted relative to the 2D plan (not a widespread mismatch).
Minor proportional/layout simplifications (corridor/partition extents) compared to the 2D plan, though overall room graph and positions remain consistent.

summary: A true cutaway 3D conversion with strong overall layout fidelity and interior detailing, with minor proportional/opening deviations and presentation text labels.
